chapterTitle: Financial Leverage and Capital Structure Policy

columns.text:
First, we have to find out the actual value of the firm which we denote with $AV$, where the earnings before interest and taxes $EI$ is $\$97,000$, tax rate $TR$ is $24\%$ and the cost of equity $CE$ is $13\%$

$$\begin{align*}
AV&=\frac{EI \times (1-TR)}{CE}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{97,000 \times (1-24\%)}{13\%}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{97,000 \times (1-0.24)}{0.13}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{97,000 \times 0.76}{0.13}\\[12pt]
&=\frac{73,720}{0.13}\\[12pt]
&=567,076.9231
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the actual value of the firm is $\boxed{\$567,076.9231}$

Second, we have to find the current value of the firm repurchased shares which we denote with $CV$, where the actual value of the firm $AV$ is $\$567,076.9231$, tax rate $TR$ is $24\%$ and the issued debt $ID$ is $\$195,000$

$$\begin{align*}
CV&=AV + (TR \times ID)\\[7pt]
&=567,076.9231 + (24\% \times 195,000)\\[7pt]
&-567,076.9231+ (0.24 \times 195,000)\\[7pt]
&=567,076.9231 + 46,800\\[7pt]
&=613,876.9231
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the current value of the firm repurchased shares is $\boxed{\$613,876.9231}$

Third, we have to find out the cost of equity after recapitalization which we denote with $CR$, where the equity $E$ is $13\%$, debt $D$ is $8\%$, issued debt $ID$ is $195,000$, the current value of the firm repurchased shares $CV$ is $613,876.9231$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $24\%$

$$\begin{align*}
CR&=E+(E-D) \times \frac{ID}{CV-ID} \times (1-TR)\\[12pt]
&=13\%+(13\%-8\%) \times \frac{195,000}{613,876.9231-195,000} \times (1-24\%)\\[12pt]
&=0.13+(0.13-0.08) \times \frac{195,000}{613,876.9231-195,000} \times (1-0.24)\\[12pt]
&=0.13+0.05 \times \frac{195,000}{418,876.9231} \times 0.76\\[12pt]
&=0.13+0.05 \times 0.4655 \times 0.76\\[12pt]
&=0.13 + 0.01768\\[7pt]
&=0.1476\\[7pt]
&=14.76\%

\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the  cost of equity after recapitalization is $\boxed{14.76\%}$

Fourth, we have to find out the weighted average cost of capital which we denote with $WA$, where the current value of the firm repurchased shares $CV$ is $613,876.9231$, issued debt $ID$ is $195,000$, cost of equity after recapitalization $CR$ is $14.76\%$, debt $D$ is $8\%$ and the tax rate $TR$ is $24\%$

$$\begin{align*}
WA&=\biggl(\frac{CV-ID}{CV} \times CR\biggl) + \biggl(\frac{ID}{CV} \times D \times (1-TR)\biggl)\\[12pt]
&=\biggl(\frac{613,876.9231-195,000}{613,876.9231} \times 14.76\%\biggl) \phantom{}\\&+ \biggl(\frac{195,000}{613,876.9231} \times 8\% \times (1-24\%)\biggl)\\[12pt]
&=\biggl(\frac{418,876.9231}{613,876.9231} \times 0.1476\biggl) + \biggl(\frac{195,000}{613,876.9231} \times 0.08 \times (1-0.24)\biggl)\\[12pt]
&=\biggl(0.6823 \times 0.1476\biggl) + \biggl(0.3176 \times 0.08 \times 0.76\biggl)\\[12pt]
&=0.1007+0.01931\\[7pt]
&=0.12\\[7pt]
&=12\%
\end{align*}$$

Therefore, the weighted average cost of capital is $\boxed{12\%}$
